data.repeater_password: Update Password (leave blank to keep current)

send_message.name: Send Message
send_message.description: Send a message to a MeshCore node

node_id.name: Node ID
node_id.description: The ID of the node to send the message to

send_channel_message.name: Send channel message
send_channel_message.description: Send a text message to a MeshCore public channel.

channel_idx.name: Channel Index
channel_idx.description: The index number of the channel to send to.

message.name: Message
message.description: The message to send to the channel.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

send_ui_message.name: Send UI Message
send_ui_message.description: Send a message using the MeshCore UI helpers. This service reads values from 'select.meshcore_recipient_type', 'select.meshcore_channel', 'select.meshcore_contact', and 'text.meshcore_message' to determine the recipient and message content. Call this service directly from a button card for a seamless messaging interface.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

execute_command.name: Execute MeshCore Command
execute_command.description: Execute a command provided by the MeshCore Python library. This is an advanced feature that provides direct access to the underlying commands interface. CAUTION: Some commands will make PERMANENT CHANGES to your node's configuration. Use with care.

command.name: Command
command.description: The command with parameters to execute. Format is "[command_name] [param1] [param2] ..." Examples: - set_name "MyDevice" - send_msg "f293ac" "Hello from Home Assistant!" - get_bat - set_tx_power 20 - set_coords 37.7749 -122.4194

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

execute_command_ui.name: Execute Command from UI
execute_command_ui.description: Execute a command using the text.meshcore_command helper entity. This service reads the command from the text helper and executes it. It will automatically clear the input field after execution.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

add_selected_contact.name: Add Selected Contact
add_selected_contact.description: Add the contact selected in the discovered contact select entity to your node's contact list.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

remove_selected_contact.name: Remove Selected Contact
remove_selected_contact.description: Remove the contact selected in the added contact select entity from your node's contact list.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

remove_discovered_contact.name: Remove Discovered Contact
remove_discovered_contact.description: Remove a discovered contact from the discovered contacts list. This will remove the contact from Home Assistant but does NOT remove it from your node's contact list. You can specify the pubkey_prefix directly, or leave it blank to use the selected contact from the discovered contact select entity.

pubkey_prefix.name: Public Key Prefix
pubkey_prefix.description: The public key prefix (at least 6 characters) of the contact to remove. Leave empty to use the selected contact from the discovered contact select entity.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to use the first available device.

cleanup_unavailable_contacts.name: Cleanup Unavailable Contacts
cleanup_unavailable_contacts.description: Remove all unavailable MeshCore contact binary sensors from Home Assistant.

entry_id.name: Config Entry ID
entry_id.description: The config entry ID if you have multiple MeshCore devices. Leave empty to clean all devices.
